intro: Rhamnus sarcomphalus, commonly known as the narrowleaf buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by dark blue berries that are edible for certain bird species. It thrives in a variety of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions and full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
